Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR EMPLOYEE SERVICES Tennessee Technology Center at Memphis Department of Safety VENDOR PARTY PROCURING PARTY THIS MEMORANDUM signifies agreement of the above parties concerning the provision of EMPLOYEE SERVICES. This agreement is as follows: A. Vendor agrees to furnish the services of its employee(s) to perform the following services for Procuring Party: Administer the Commercial Driver License Skills Test consisting of the Pre-Trip Inspection, the Basic Control Skills and the Road Test according to the latest Commercial Driver License Examiners’ Manual issued by the American Association of Motor Vehicle Administration through the Tennessee Department of Safety. Services to include all record keeping and issuance of certificate forms as stated in CDL Third Party Rules and Regulations. Vendor agrees to furnish a bi-monthly activity log including a scored test sheet for each applicant tested. B. The specific employees to provide these services are as follows: EMPLOYEE: Billy Ingram SOCIAL SECURITY NO. EMPLOYEE: Jeff Weaver SOCIAL SECURITY NO. C. The maximum number of tests per month covered under this agreement is 120. Testing should take place only outside the regularly scheduled work day and/or during periods of annual leave. D. Compensation to Vendor Party will be $90.51 per test (including cost of any applicable staff benefits to Vendor’s employee for service under this agreement.) Service Amount 75.00 FICA & Medicare 5.74 Retirement 9.77 Total Agreement 90.51 (Benefit amounts will be automatically adjusted to match any changes in State/Federal policy.) E. Procuring Party will make payment to Vendor on a monthly basis after completion of services and when a uniquely numbered invoice with copies of completed CDL activity log and scored test sheets have been received at the following address: Tennessee Department of Safety Attn: Christina Krause 1150 Foster Avenue Nashville, TN 37210 615-251-5217 F. Upon receipt of payment from the Procuring Party, the Vendor will process compensation for the respective employee. Payment will be sent to the address of the Vendor Party as follows: Tennessee Technology Center at Memphis 550 Alabama Avenue Memphis, TN 38105-3604 901-543-6131 G. Contract term: July 14, 2008 through June 30, 2010 H. This agreement cannot be assigned or subcontracted without written consent of all parties. I. During the performance of this contract both parties warrant that they will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, age, religion, creed, color, sex, disability, veteran status, or national origin. The parties will take affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed and that employees are treated during employment without regard to their race, religion, creed, color, sex, age, disability, veteran status or national origin. Such action shall include, but not be limited to the following: employment, upgrading, demotion, transfer; recruitment or recruitment advertising; layoff or termination; rates of pay or other forms of compensation; and selection available to employees and applicants for employment. J. Either party may terminate this agreement by giving written notice to the other at least 30 days before the effective date of termination. In that event, vendors shall be entitled to receive just and equitable compensation for any compensation for any satisfactory work completed as of the termination date. K. Shall the Vendor Party fail to fulfill in a timely manner his obligation under this agreement or if the Vendor Party shall violate any of the material terms of this agreement, the Procuring Party shall have the right to immediately terminate this agreement and withhold payments in excess of fair compensation for work completed.
